summary: Email correspondence between attorney Teri Gibbs and an unnamed recipient regarding two clients who believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in June 2004. The attorney is following up to confirm whether her clients appear in photographs seized from Epstein's home and arranging interviews for them.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney who sent emails on November 18, 2019 and August 5, 2019 regarding two clients who believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in June 2004. She is arranging interviews and seeking confirmation about whether her clients appear in seized photographs.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator against whom victim reports have been made. The email discusses photographs seized from his home and allegations of assault from June 2004.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Gibbs is representing clients who allege they were assaulted by Epstein, making her professionally opposed to him in a legal context.

events.title: Alleged assaults by Epstein
events.description: Two clients of Teri Gibbs believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Initial discussion about victims
events.description: Teri Gibbs' firm spoke with an unnamed party regarding clients who allege assault by Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled interview for victim
events.description: One victim (Ms. [redacted]) was available for an in-person interview on August 26 or 27, 2019.

events.title: Follow-up email about photographs
events.description: Teri Gibbs followed up regarding whether her clients appear in photographs seized from Epstein's home.

keyFacts: Two new alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein are represented by attorney Teri Gibbs, with assaults claimed to have occurred around June 2004.
The attorney is seeking confirmation about whether her clients appear in photographs seized from Epstein's home during the investigation.
Interviews were being arranged for the victims in August 2019, indicating ongoing investigation activities after Epstein's death.
The email correspondence shows continued legal follow-up regarding victim identification and evidence review in late 2019.
